Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan is set to face Afghanistan in a Super 4 clash at Asia Cup 2022 tomorrow, September 7 (Wednesday).
The Boys in Green will be high on confident before heading into this fixture following their victory over India in the first match of this round-robin stage.
Afghanistan will look to get back to winning ways after their narrow defeat against Sri Lanka.
A victory against the Afghans tomorrow will ensure their berth in the final of the continental tournament.
This contest will be a do-or-die match for Mohammad Nabi's side as a defeat against Pakistan will knock them out of the competition.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan vs Afghanistan have faced off against each other for just two times in T20 Internationals.
On both occasions, Pakistan have emerged victorious against the Afghans.
For Pakistan, again a lot would rest on Babar Azam and Shadab Khan with Mohammad Rizwan being still doubtful in this match.
Afghanistan on the other hand, would want Ibrahim Zadran and Rahmanullah Gurbaz to carry on in the same form along with Rashid Khan, who has been bowling beautifully.
The contest between Babar Azam and Rashid Khan would be interesting to watch.
Another duel that fans would be keen on looking forward to is the one between Mohammad Nabi and Shadab Khan.
Others: Pakistan would be brimming with confidence after edging the Men in Blue by five wickets in a last-over thriller.
Shadab Khan took two wickets while Nawaz was at it again, snaring one as India were restricted to 181 runs despite a blistering start to their innings in the batting powerplay.
Afghanistan would look to start from where they left off in the group stage, with winning two back-to-back matches.
Against Sri Lanka, they were not able to produce that spark in their bowling attack which is one of the main strengths in this Afghan team in this tournament.
Spinners Rashid Khan and Mujeeb Ur Rahman have been fantastic for them so far and a lot would be depended on their performance against Babar Azam's team.
Afghanistan will also bank on the batting of Hazratullah Zazai, Ibrahim Zadran and Rahmanullah Gurbaz in this match.
Pakistan has suffered an injury blow with pacer Shahnawaz Dahani being ruled out of the Asia Cup 2022.
